TopicTitle: The Proper Way to put Man into Space

Articles.Content:
<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Dra0kFckpU4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Dat haw u do et!
As this is not about KSP itself, moved to off-topic lounge.

So yeah, it's basically a game about medieval engineering. A guy on the besiege forums suggested I posted it here so I did for the lulz. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Very low ISP on the SRB you use (is it cannons pointing downward?)

I made an two stage rocket in bad piggies game for phones, it rammed to top of the level, fixed it so it touched the top, pig landed in parachute.

Well, I can use a mod now which uses flamethrowers for rocket thrusters, but I didn't on this particular rocket. And yeah, besiege is kinda like a 3d version of bad piggies and instead of the box2d engine uses Unity. Hop on. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

\*cough\*Needs more boosters\*cough\*

Still, your delivery method is impresive.

Welcome to the kerbal forums!

Tried besiege, but I think I'll wait and see if the design thing improves, I'm too used to ksp's symmetry options.
